channel.title: Networking (Java)
channel.description:
I want to get involved in Networking because it interests me. So, the main point of this topic is to ask a few questions:
Which is better? DataOutputStream, or another form of I/O (NIO). I do know that using MINA is best, but keep in mind I made this topic because I'm a noob to networking.
And, how should I get started with networking? What would you recommend personally? (This question is mainly just suggestions, because I need a place to start.)

item.title: Networking (Java)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Ohhh, TPC. I thought you meant TCP. THIS IS WHY WE CANT ABBREVIATE EVERYTHING! XD

Usually you just assign a client a socket, and it stores that information in itself.

For example in Player.java there would be a Socket variable that says ‘THIS IS THE SOCKET THIS PLAYER IS FROM’, or the connection handler has a map (<Socket, Player> or vice versa) that says ‘OK THIS SOCKET MATCHES THIS PLAYER’

Read full topic

item.title: Networking (Java)
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:415033”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=516991.msg3754574#msg3754574 date=1316325319]
I’m also having trouble understanding how servers function without using TPC (w/SocketChannels? Not sure what they are). Mind explaining that? :o
[/quote]Not sure what you mean with that, but if you’re asking the difference between TCP and UDP use the link Rix gave.[/quote]
That link helped me learn a bit about the uses of TCP and UDP, but it wasn’t my question. I’ve always seen a server accepting a client written with a new thread (Yeah, TPC). I’m curious as to how the server finds the correct client to send the information to (I think that’s how to word it correctly).

Read full topic

Mind explaining that? :o[/quote]Not sure what you mean with that, but if you’re asking the difference between TCP and UDP use the link Rix gave.

Hmmmm, true I feel like I hope he knows more now though, because the feedback from the last conversation we had was all criticism >.>
Davidi2, you up for it?[/quote]People were just flaming you posting it iirc, but I’m always on IRC if I’m on mopar, so feel free to ask whenever you want

item.title: Networking (Java)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I really enjoy using my own implementation of NIO, it always seems more personal than using other libraries. If you really want scalability and stability go ahead and use MINA or Netty, but if you’re learning go ahead and try to use your own

Read full topic
